action.primary: Disperses Blood Stasis and stops bleeding

indications: Internal injuries due to trauma, fractures, sprains or contusions
Topically alone or with other herbs to stop bleeding from lacerations

action.primary: Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi and alleviates pain

indications: Epigastric and abdominal pain due to stagnant Qi in the Spleen and Stomach
Chest pain due to Blood Stasis

action.primary: Harmonizes the Middle Jiao and relieves nausea

contraindications: Contraindicated in the absence of Blood Stasis.
Contraindicated for those with Blood Heat.
Contraindicated for those with Yin Deficiency with Excess Fire.

useCases: Internally and topically for pain and swelling due to trauma.
Chest and flank pain due to Stagnant Qi and Blood Stasis.

notes: Some sources classify this herb in the "Herbs that Stop Bleeding" category.
This herb treats broken bones, injuries and wounds from metal, stops bleeding, alleviates pain, reduces swelling and generates flesh.
It must be powdered to use in decoction.
Apply topically as a powder for cuts.
It treats lumbago, leg pain due to Wind-Dampness, trauma and gastralgia due to Qi Stagnation.
This herb has been shown to inhibit the growth of cancer cells.
The twig and leaf treat furuncles, sores and swellings, cough and trauma.
The fruit circulates Qi to expel Phlegm and treats dyspepsia.
The internal wood or root circulates Qi to invigorate the Blood, activates the Spleen and stops cough.
